dcterms:creator: J. Doran
P. Roohr
D. Beberwyk
G. Brooks
G. Gayno
R. Williams
B. Wickard
dcterms:description: The WRF-NMM model is utilized for numerical weather prediction, providing hourly forecasts for a 60-hour period, which includes various meteorological variables essential for fog prediction.
dcterms:title: WRF-NMM (Weather Research and Forecasting Nonhydrostatic Mesoscale Model)

dcterms:creator: J. Doran
P. Roohr
D. Beberwyk
G. Brooks
G. Gayno
R. Williams
B. Wickard
dcterms:description: The NOAA FSL method is a statistical approach for forecasting visibility and fog conditions, which is compared against the ML-based method in this study.
dcterms:title: NOAA FSL (National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration Forecast Systems Laboratory)

dcterms:description: The MICAPS dataset provides various weather measurements, including visibility, temperature, pressure, and humidity, which are used to analyze fog events.
dcterms:title: MICAPS (Meteorological Information Comprehensive Analysis and Process System)

dcterms:creator: J. Doran
P. Roohr
D. Beberwyk
G. Brooks
G. Gayno
R. Williams
B. Wickard
dcterms:description: Historical forecast data from the WRF-NMM model is used to evaluate the performance of the ML-based forecasting method for sea fog.
dcterms:title: Historical forecast data from WRF-NMM

dcterms:creator: G. Ke
Q. Meng
T. Finley
T. Wang
W. Chen
W. Ma
T.-Y. Liu
dcterms:description: LightGBM is a gradient-boosted tree-based model used for machine learning tasks, including forecasting sea fog events.
dcterms:title: LightGBM (Light Gradient Boosting Machine)
